pushbutton.label: Add Comparison Results to Migration Collection

dialog.label: Add Comparison Results to Migration Collection

helpgrid.innerhtml: Select a migration object and then select the attributes whose values you want to replace when the package is deployed. When the package is deployed, the deployment administrator can define the replacement rules or deploy the values that come from the source environment.

radiobutton.label: Show objects that have selected attributes

checkbox.label: Do you have a current backup

helpgrid.innerhtml: To resolve the data error, edit the data using standard XML syntax and then continue the package deployment. The Original Error Data field represents the data record that failed to deploy. The Error Data field shows the same content until you edit the XML.
In the hierarchy, select the migration object whose attributes you want to define replacement rules for, and click Add/Modify Rules.

In the Replacement Rules section, specify the sequence for the rules, enable the rules, and specify the database actions to which the rules apply. On the Attributes tab, specify the field for which you want to provide a substitute value. On the Conditions tab, specify the criteria under which the replacement rule is applied.
Products are numbered in the following format: version.release.modification.fix_pack -interim_fix.If the product's version or release do not match, the migration package cannot be deployed.
